clinical_study.brief_title: Comparing Partnered Yoga to Non-partnered Yoga and Standard Care for Treating Insomnia in Cancer Survivors and Caregivers
clinical_study.official_title: A Feasibility Trial Comparing the Effectiveness of Partnered YOCAS©® Yoga to Non-partnered YOCAS©® Yoga and Standard Care for Treating Insomnia in Cancer Survivors and Caregivers

brief_summary.textblock:
This phase II randomized controlled trial examines the preliminary efficacy of our standardized four-week YOCAS©® program (Yoga for Cancer Survivors) on insomnia and sleep quality in cancer survivors and their caregivers.
Insomnia can be described as excessive daytime napping, difficulty falling asleep, difficulty staying asleep, or waking up earlier than desired. The majority of patients with cancer experience some form of sleep disturbance. Caregivers who provide significant physical, emotional, and psychosocial care for patients with cancer also experience sleep disturbance. Yoga is safe, feasible, and effective for improving insomnia and sleep quality in cancer survivors. However, whether both cancer survivors and their caregivers can both improve their insomnia and sleep quality by participating in partnered yoga intervention is not known.

detailed_description.textblock:
PRIMARY OBJECTIVE:
To compare the effects of partnered YOCAS, non-partnered YOCAS interventions, and standard care on changes in insomnia measured via Insomnia Severity Index (ISI) among cancer survivors and caregivers
SECONDARY OBJECTIVE:
To compare the effects of partnered YOCAS, non-partnered YOCAS interventions, and standard care on changes in sleep quality measured via Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index (PSQI) among cancer survivors and caregivers
OUTLINE: Cancer survivor-caregiver dyads are randomized to 1 of 3 arms.
ARM I: Standard Care: Cancer survivor-caregiver dyads receive their standard care
ARM II: Partnered YOCAS: Cancer survivor-caregiver dyads participate in 8 virtual Zoom YOCAS sessions (75 minutes/session, 2 times a week for 4 weeks) together
ARM III: Non-partnered YOCAS: Cancer survivors participate in 8 virtual Zoom YOCAS sessions (75 minutes/session, 2 times a week for 4 weeks) alone; caregivers do not receive Zoom YOCAS sessions

primary_outcome.measure: Mean change in insomnia as measured by the Insomnia Severity Index (ISI) total score comparing cancer survivors in the Partnered YOCAS vs. the Non-partnered YOCAS
primary_outcome.description: The Insomnia Severity Index is a validated measure of insomnia. A 5-point Likert scale of 7 questions is used to rate each item (e.g., 0 = no problem; 4 = very severe problem), yielding a total score ranging from 0 to 28 with higher scores indicating higher severity of insomnia. A linear mixed effects ANCOVA will be used to assess the statistical significance of the differences in mean change among cancer survivors in the Partnered YOCAS vs. Non-partnered YOCAS

arm_group.description: Cancer survivor-caregiver dyads receive their standard care
Cancer survivor-caregiver duads receive 8 virtual Zoom yoga sessions (75 minutes/session, 2 times a week for 4 weeks) together
Cancer survivors receive 8 virtual Zoom yoga sessions (75 minutes/session, 2 times a week for 4 weeks) along; caregivers do not receive virtual Zoom yoga sessions.

intervention.description: Standard Care is used as a control condition. Cancer survivor-caregiver dyads assigned to this arm continue to do what they would normally in their lives and standard care will be provided for the cancer survivor.

Partnered Yoga for Cancer Survivors, YOCAS©®, intervention is a low to moderate intensity mode of exercise that draws from two basic types of yoga; gentle Hatha and Restorative yoga. The program includes specific physical postures and mindfulness exercises focused on breathing and meditation. Cancer survivors and their caregivers will participate in 8 virtual Zoom YOCAS sessions (75 minutes/session, 2 times a week for 4 weeks) together.

Non-partnered Yoga for Cancer Survivors, YOCAS©®, Intervention is a low to moderate intensity mode of exercise that draws from two basic types of yoga; gentle Hatha and Restorative yoga. The program includes specific physical postures and mindfulness exercises focused on breathing and meditation. Cancer survivors will participate in 8 virtual Zoom YOCAS sessions (75 minutes/session, 2 times a week for 4 weeks) along; caregivers do not receive virtual Zoom YOCAS sessions.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Cancer Survivors must:
- have a confirmed diagnosis of cancer
- have received surgery, chemotherapy, and/or radiation therapy
- have completed all surgery, chemotherapy, and/or radiation therapy within the last 2 months to 10 years
- meet DSM-V criteria for insomnia and score ≥10 on the Insomnia Severity Index
- be able to read and understand English
- be able to provide informed consent
- have a caregiver who is also willing and able to participate in study interventions and assessments, and who meet the caregiver inclusion criteria
- have access to the internet and a smartphone, tablet, and/or computer
- have the ability to attend 8 virtual yoga sessions together with their caregivers
Caregivers must:
- have provided significant physical, emotional, and/or psychosocial support to the cancer survivor who is also willing and able to participate in study interventions and assessments and meet the cancer survivor inclusion criteria.
- meet DSM-V criteria for insomnia and score >10 on the Insomnia Severity Index.
- be able to read and understand English
- be able to provide informed consent
- have access to the internet and a smartphone, tablet, and/or computer
- have the ability to attend 8 virtual yoga sessions together with the cancer survivor enrolling in the study
Exclusion Criteria:
Cancer Survivor must not:
- have contraindications to yoga participation
- have practiced yoga within the 3 months prior to enrolling in the study
- be planning to start yoga on their own during the time they are enrolled in the study
- have a confirmed diagnosis of sleep apnea or restless leg syndrome
- be receiving any form of treatment for cancer with the exception of hormonal or biologic therapy
- have distant metastases
Caregivers must not:
- have contraindications to yoga participation
- have practiced yoga within the 3 months prior to enrolling in the study
- be planning to start yoga on their own during the time they are enrolled in the study
- have a confirmed diagnosis of sleep apnea or restless leg syndrome
